questions.question: When a point is in the 1st quadrant, where is it located with respect to the Vertical Plane (VP) and Horizontal Plane (HP)?

answers.A: In front of VP and above HP
answers.D: In front of VP and below HP

questions.explanation: In the 1st quadrant, the object is located in front of the VP and above the HP.

questions.question: In which quadrant does a point lie if it is above the Horizontal Plane (HP) and on the Vertical Plane (VP)?
questions.explanation: If the point lies on VP and above HP, it can be in either the 1st or 2nd quadrant.

questions.question: What is the significance of the notation a’’ in the given context?
questions.explanation: a’’ represents the side/profile view of a point in orthographic projection.

questions.question: When a point is below the Horizontal Plane (HP) and in front of the Vertical Plane (VP), where is its top view located?
questions.explanation: In the 4th quadrant, the top view lies below XY line.

questions.question: How is the upper part of the Vertical Plane (VP) represented after clockwise rotation in the 2nd quadrant?
questions.explanation: After rotation in 2nd quadrant, the VP appears above XY line.

questions.question: What is the representation of a point in the first quadrant with respect to VP and HP?

answers.A: In front of VP and below HP
answers.C: In front of VP and above HP

questions.explanation: In the 1st quadrant, a point lies in front of VP and above HP.

questions.question: What is the common characteristic of points in the 3rd quadrant?
questions.explanation: In the 3rd quadrant, the object lies behind the VP and below the HP.

questions.question: How is the lower part of the Vertical Plane (VP) represented after clockwise rotation in the 4th quadrant?
questions.explanation: In the 4th quadrant, the VP appears below the XY line after rotation.

questions.question: What is the position of a point in Experiment 4 in relation to VP and HP?

answers.A: In front of VP and above HP
answers.D: In front of VP and below HP

questions.explanation: The 4th quadrant position is in front of VP and below HP.

questions.question: When a point is on the Horizontal Plane (HP) and behind the Vertical Plane (VP), where is its top view located?
questions.explanation: If the point lies on HP and behind VP (2nd quadrant), its top view lies above XY.

questions.question: When a point is on the Horizontal Plane (HP) and in front of the Vertical Plane (VP), where is its top view located?
questions.explanation: When on HP and in front of VP (1st quadrant), the top view lies below XY.

questions.question: What is the position of a point when it is below the Horizontal Plane (HP) and behind the Vertical Plane (VP)?
questions.explanation: In the 3rd quadrant, the point lies behind VP and below HP.

questions.question: What is the representation of a point above the Horizontal Plane (HP) and behind the Vertical Plane (VP) in the 2nd quadrant?

answers.C: Above XY in front view, below XY in top view
answers.D: Below XY in front view, above XY in top view

questions.explanation: In the 2nd quadrant, the point is behind VP (top view above XY) and above HP (front view above XY).
